admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia

abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the Private
            Industry Recovery Project is to foster a speedy revival of
            the private manufacturing sector after its collapse as a
            consequence of the recent political instability. The project
            will finance Albanian Guarantee Agency (AGA), which will
            issue guarantees to entities that finance productive
            activities in Albania. The project consists of three
            components. 1) Albania will contribute US$0.7 million as
            issued and paid-in capital for AGA. 2) Start-up costs
            (US$0.25 million) of the Albania Guarantee Agency will cover
            AGA's initial start-up costs for capital expenditures
            and administrative expenses in its first year. 3) Political
            Risks Guarantee Facility (US$20 million), managed by AGA,
            will mitigate the perceived risks that are preventing the
            private sector from having access to commercial financing
            for productive transactions or from risking their own funds
            to re-enter the market. As guarantees are issued, the funds
            will be placed in escrow with an agent bank outside Albania
            under liability until the guarantee runs off. The agent bank
            will also issue the beneficiary of the AGA an irrevocable
            standby letter of credit to ensure security.
